news.title: U.S. payroll growth totals 177,000 in April, defying expectations
news.summary: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 133,000 in April, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate. The economy is expected to grow by 0.4 percent in the first quarter.

news.title: Trump calls on Fed once again to lower rates after solid April jobs report
news.summary: President Donald Trump calls for the U.S. Federal Reserve to lower interest rates. His call comes after a better-than-expected jobs report for April.

news.title: Trump vows to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status: 'It's what they deserve!'
news.summary: Trump has sought to extract concessions and changes from Harvard and other schools. He has threatened to withhold federal research grants from the schools if they don't make changes.

news.title: Chevron stock falls as lower profits and oil prices set to slow the pace of stock buybacks
news.summary: U.S. crude oil prices have fallen as President Donald Trump's tariffs raise recession fears. OPEC+ pumps more oil and is expected to continue to do so.

news.title: Apple clears Spotify update under new rules allowing purchases within apps
news.summary: The approval comes after a U.S. federal judge on Wednesday ordered Apple to stop imposing the commissions it makes on purchases through iPhone apps.

news.title: This is why Reddit’s stock is rising after earnings
news.summary: Social-media platform’s daily active unique users were up 31% from a year earlier. Social-media platforms’ daily activeUniqueUsers (DACs) were up 30% from the previous year. DACs are the number of people who use a social-media site every day.

news.title: Trump’s tariffs are America’s Brexit, says this strategist. These are the trades to make.
news.summary: A waning AI bubble is another reason to favor European equity benchmarks over the U.S., says BCA strategist Dhaval Joshi. The BCA is a leading global equity research and analytics firm.

news.title: ‘Money means nothing to my wealthy clients’: My coworkers step on each other to get ahead. How do I create a nontoxic culture at work?
news.summary: “Money means nothing to them. They can spend $10,000 on an antique credenza or $5,000. on a side table,” he says.

news.title: Wall Street firm estimates Trump deportations running at one-tenth of his 1 million goal
news.summary: Trump administration's deportations are running well short of the 1 million per year goal he’s advocated, according to one estimate. The White House says the goal is to deport 1 million people a year.

news.title: Student-loan borrowers plead with policymakers to end ‘nightmare’ as Republicans plot major changes to repayment plans
news.summary: Both the Trump administration and Congressional Republicans are eyeing drastic shifts in income-driven repayment and Public Service Loan Forgiveness. Both the Obama and GOP-led Congress are looking to change the way federal loans are repaid.
